intro: Aglaia taynguyenensis, commonly known as the Tay Nguyen aglaia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are woody capsules that contain several seeds. Aglaia taynguyenensis is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
